Package org.hyperledger.fabric.client

Interface Network

  • public interface Network
    The Network represents a Fabric network (channel). Network instances are obtained from a Gateway using the Gateway.getNetwork(String) method.

    The Network provides the ability for applications to:

    • Obtain a specific smart contract deployed to the network using getContract(String), in order to submit and evaluate transactions for that smart contract.
    See Also:
    Developing Fabric Applications - Network Channel

    • Method Detail

      • getContract

        Contract getContract​(String chaincodeId)
        Get an instance of a contract on the current network.
        Parameters:
        chaincodeId - The name of the chaincode that implements the smart contract.
        Returns:
        The contract object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the chaincode ID is null.

      • getContract

        Contract getContract​(String chaincodeId,
                     String name)
        Get an instance of a contract on the current network. If the chaincode instance contains more than one smart contract class (available using the latest chaincode programming model), then an individual class can be selected.
        Parameters:
        chaincodeId - The name of the chaincode that implements the smart contract.
        name - The class name of the smart contract within the chaincode.
        Returns:
        The contract object.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the chaincode ID is null.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of the network channel.
        Returns:
        The network name.

      • newSignedCommit

        Commit newSignedCommit​(byte[] bytes,
                       byte[] signature)
                throws com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException
        Create a commit with the specified digital signature, which can be used to access information about a transaction that is committed to the ledger. Supports off-line signing flow.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Serialized commit status request.
        signature - Digital signature.
        Returns:
        A signed commit status request.
        Throws:
        com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException - if the supplied commit bytes are not a valid commit.

      • getChaincodeEvents

        Iterator<ChaincodeEvent> getChaincodeEvents​(String chaincodeId)
        Get events emitted by transaction functions of a specific chaincode. Note that the returned Iterator may throw StatusRuntimeException during iteration if a gRPC connection error occurs.
        Parameters:
        chaincodeId - A chaincode ID.
        Returns:
        Ordered sequence of events.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the chaincode ID is null.

      • newChaincodeEventsRequest

        ChaincodeEventsRequest newChaincodeEventsRequest​(String chaincodeId)
        Create a chaincode events request, which can be used to obtain events emitted by transaction functions of a specific chaincode. Supports off-line signing flow.
        Parameters:
        chaincodeId - A chaincode ID.
        Returns:
        A chaincode events request.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the chaincode ID is null.

      • newSignedChaincodeEventsRequest

        ChaincodeEventsRequest newSignedChaincodeEventsRequest​(byte[] bytes,
                                                       byte[] signature)
                                                throws com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException
        Create a chaincode events request with the specified digital signature, which can be used to obtain events emitted by transaction functions of a specific chaincode. Supports off-line signing flow.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Serialized chaincode events request.
        signature - Digital signature.
        Returns:
        A signed chaincode events request.
        Throws:
        com.google.protobuf.InvalidProtocolBufferException - if the supplied chaincode events request bytes are not valid.
